content.text: Solve the equation \(\left|4x - 5\right| = 21.\)
Given that the straight line \(y = 3x + c\) is a tangent to the curve \(y = x^{2} + 9x + k,\) express \(k\) in terms of \(c\)
Without using a calculator, find the value of \(\cos \theta\), giving your answer in the form \(\frac{a + b\sqrt{3}}{c}\), where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers
Given that \(y = \frac{1}{x^{2} + 3}\) , show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{kx}{(x^{2} + 3)^{2}}\) , where \(k\) is a constant to be found
Hence find \(\int \frac{6x}{(x^{2} + 3)^{2}} \mathrm{~d}x\) and evaluate \(\int_{1}^{3} \frac{6x}{(x^{2} + 3)^{2}} \mathrm{~d}x\)
The functions f and g are defined, for \(x \in \mathbb{R}\), by
Find \(\mathrm{fg}(4)\)
\(x\mapsto \sqrt{x + 4}\)
\(x\mapsto x + 8\)
\(x\mapsto x^{2} - 4\)
The functions h and k are defined, for \(x > 0\), by
Express each of the following in terms of h and k
Solutions to this question by accurate drawing will not be accepted
The points \(A(1, 4)\), \(B(3, 8)\), \(C(13, 13)\) and \(D\) are the vertices of a trapezium in which \(AB\) is parallel to \(DC\) and angle \(BAD\) is \(90^{\circ}\). Find the coordinates of \(D\)
Given that \(\tan x = p\), find an expression, in terms of \(p\), for \(\cos \mathrm{e}^{2}x\)
Prove that \((1 + \sec \theta)(1 - \cos \theta) = \sin \theta \tan \theta.\)
Given that \(\overrightarrow{OX} = \mu \overrightarrow{OP}\), where \(\mu\) is a constant, express \(\overrightarrow{OX}\) in terms of \(\mu\), \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\)
Given also that \(\overrightarrow{AX} = \lambda \overrightarrow{OB}\), where \(\lambda\) is a constant, use a vector method to find the value of \(\mu\) and of \(\lambda\)
In the diagram \(\overrightarrow{OA} = \mathbf{a}, \overrightarrow{OB} = \mathbf{b}\) and \(\overrightarrow{AP} = \frac{2}{5} \overrightarrow{AB}\)
Complete the following table
On the grid on page 11 plot \(y\sqrt{x}\) against \(x\sqrt{x}\) and draw a straight line graph
Use your graph to estimate the value of \(a\) and of \(b\)
Estimate the value of \(y\) when \(x\) is 1.5
The table shows experimental values of two variables \(x\) and \(y\)
It is known that \(x\) and \(y\) are related by the equation \(y = \frac{a}{\sqrt{x}} + bx\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants
Find \(2\mathbf{A} - \mathbf{B}\)
Find \(\mathbf{BA}\)
Find the inverse matrix, \(\mathbf{A}^{-1}\)
Use your answer to part (iii) to solve the simultaneous equations
It is given that \(\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 3 & 2 \\ 1 & -5 \end{pmatrix}\) and \(\mathbf{B} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 4 \\ -2 & 3 \end{pmatrix}\)
Solve \(1 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{~y} + 1 \mathrm{~g}(\mathrm{y} - 15) = 2\)
Without using a calculator, and showing each stage of your working, find the value of
Find, in terms of ln 2, the coordinates of \(A, B, C\) and \(D\)
Given that \(\frac{\mathrm{Area~of~triangle~}BPD}{\mathrm{Area~of~triangle~}APC} = \frac{1}{k},\) express \(k\) in terms of \(\ln 2.\)

The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = \ln (x + 1) - \ln x.\) The tangent to the curve at the point \(P\) (1, \(\ln 2)\) meets the \(x\)-axis at \(A\) and the \(y\)-axis at \(B.\) The normal to the curve at \(P\) meets the \(x\)-axis at \(C\) and the \(y\)-axis at \(D.\)
Find, in terms of e, the coordinates of \(P\) and determine the nature of this stationary point.
The normal to the curve at the point \(Q\) (1, e) meets the \(x\)-axis at \(R\) and the \(y\)-axis at \(S\)
Find, in terms of e, the area of triangle \(ORS,\) where \(O\) is the origin
A curve has equation \(y = x\mathrm{e}^{x}.\) The curve has a stationary point at \(P.\)
Answer only **one** of the following two alternatives
